intro: Cyrtandra panayensis, commonly known as the Panay piper. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, native to the island of Panay in the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in lowland to montane forests. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, Cyrtandra panayensis is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
